pull.title: refactor: Revert additional univalue check in ParseSighashString
pull.body:
This is a follow up for #28113.

The string type check is already done by the rpc parser / RPCHelpMan. Re-doing it is adding dead code. Instead, throwing an exception when the assumption does not hold is the already correct behavior. Pointed out in this [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28113/files#r1274568557).

Also correct the release note for the correct sighashtype exception change. There is no change in the handling of non-string sighashtype arugments. Pointed out in this [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28113/files#r1274567555).

events.body:
Updated cc266f9ccd669866ee3121c8c03e08cd836ffba6 -> 06199a995f20c55583f6948cfe99e608679fcdf1 ([kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_0](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_0) -> [kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_1),  [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_0..kernelRmUnivalueFollowup_1))

* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28162#discussion_r1274785751), changed univalue fuzz test implementation as suggested and added a docstring for documenting the function's precondition.
* Addressed @jonatack's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28162#discussion_r1275510880), changed description as suggested.

verification.payload:
tree 548887a67d57fc0daf2291c69c321cfea7c8a03b
parent 0b47c1621524a96b79cbdc3c45ee5ad36e7ba541
author TheCharlatan <seb.kung@gmail.com> 1690364394 +0200
committer TheCharlatan <seb.kung@gmail.com> 1690443365 +0200

refactor: Revert addition of univalue sighash string check

This check is already done by the rpc parser. Re-doing it is adding dead
code. Instead, throwing an exception when the assumption does not hold
is the already correct behavior.

To make the fuzz test more accurate and not swallow all runtime errors,
add a check that the passed in UniValue sighash argument is either a
string or null.

Co-authored-by: stickies-v <stickies-v@protonmail.com>

events.body:
Tested ACK 06199a995f20c55583f6948cfe99e608679fcdf1

Verified relevant tests still pass after cherry-picking 647d95a from #28166 to this branch. 

I don't mind re-ACKing if you like the suggestion in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28162#discussion_r1276034368 (mind the spaces on the last line of its diff or run clang-format on it).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,5 +3,5 @@ RPC Wallet
 
 - The `signrawtransactionwithkey`, `signrawtransactionwithwallet`,
   `walletprocesspsbt` and `descriptorprocesspsbt` calls now return more
-  specific RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER instead of RPC_PARSE_ERROR if their
-  sighashtype argument is malformed or not a string.
+  specific RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER instead of RPC_MISC_ERROR if their
comments.body: suggestion: `s/now return more specific RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER/now raise the more specific RPC_INVALID_PARAMETER error/`

comments.body: I'm not set on it, it's just the language the JSON RPC spec [uses](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification). Otherwise I'm okay with your suggestion.
I think you forgot to remove this?
Might also want to catch it NOT throwing an error when it ought to.
